channel.title: Vb calculator
channel.description:
Just made my first "real" programme :P
[url=http://uppit.com/2mabrkelkf2e/WindowsApplication1.exe]http://uppit.com/2mabrkelkf2e/WindowsApplication1.exe[/url]
[code]
Public Class Form1 Dim total1 As Single Dim total2 As Single Private Sub Form1_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load
End Sub
Private Sub btnzero_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnzero.Click TextBox1.Text = btnzero.Text End Sub
Private Sub btnone_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnone.Click TextBox1.Text = btnone.Text End Sub
Private Sub btntwo_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btntwo.Click TextBox1.Text = btntwo.Text End Sub
Private Sub btnthree_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnthree.Click TextBox1.Text = btnthree.Text End Sub
Private Sub btnfour_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnfour.Click TextBox1.Text = btnfour.Text End Sub
Private Sub btnfive_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnfive.Click TextBox1.Text = btnfive.Text End Sub
Private Sub btnsix_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnsix.Click TextBox1.Text = btnsix.Text End Sub
Private Sub btnseven_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnseven.Click TextBox1.Text = btnseven.Text End Sub
Private Sub btneight_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btneight.Click TextBox1.Text = btneight.Text End Sub
Private Sub btn9_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnnine.Click TextBox1.Text = btnnine.Text End Sub
Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click total1 = total1 + Val(TextBox1.Text)
TextBox1.Clear() End Sub
Private Sub Button2_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button2.Click total2 = total2 + Val(TextBox1.Text) + total1 TextBox1.Clear()
TextBox1.Text = total2 End Sub
Private Sub Button4_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs)
End Sub
Private Sub Button3_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button3.Click TextBox1.Clear() total1 = 0 total2 = 0 End Sub End Class [/code]

item.title: Vb calculator
item.dc:creator: @zhanghuxyz zhanghuxyz
item.description:
@zhanghuxyz wrote:

Well, I managed to give a prompt if I divide by Zero using the \ division operator instead of / however in my calculator I programmed using the same Try…Catch…Finally arguments I used for the \ division operator, it doesn’t give me a prompt stating “attempted to divide by zero” instead…if I place the following into the calculator :

0 / 0 the answer is “NaN” if I type in
ugg boots

100 / 0 the answer is “Infinity”

Is this supposed to be this way or is there an argument I can use to avoid the result of NaN and Infinity?.

It seems that most articles I read on Vb.Net NaN and Infinity they seem to speak as though this “Not a number” is a new “ugg schuhe”

Read full topic

item.title: Vb calculator
item.dc:creator: @VbCoder VbCoder
item.description:
@VbCoder wrote:

@John: read his sig

@Whip of soulz:
Not bad, but it isn’t necessary to make all those buttons, you can do something like this:
-Create one button and one textbox
-Right click on the form and select ‘view code’
-Paste this between ‘Public Class Form1’ and ‘End Class’:

Function Calculate(ByVal first As Double, ByVal second As Double) Dim dblSum As Double = first + second Return dblSum End Function
-Doubleclick on the button and now add this:

Dim dblResult As Double = first + second Return dblResult

And you’re finished (:

So… when you put something in the textbox like: 100+25, this will happen:
-The button will declare dblNumber as an array, and the first piece of the array is what you type before the ‘+’, the second piece is what you type after the ‘+’.
-Then it displays a messagebox with the result.
For that, it uses to the function you created.

Read full topic

item.title: Vb calculator
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

Just made my first “real” programme

http://uppit.com/2mabrkelkf2e/WindowsApplication1.exe


Public Class Form1
    Dim total1 As Single
    Dim total2 As Single
    Private Sub Form1_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load

    End Sub

    Private Sub btnzero_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnzero.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btnzero.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub btnone_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnone.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btnone.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub btntwo_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btntwo.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btntwo.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub btnthree_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnthree.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btnthree.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub btnfour_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnfour.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btnfour.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub btnfive_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnfive.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btnfive.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub btnsix_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnsix.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btnsix.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub btnseven_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnseven.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btnseven.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub btneight_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btneight.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btneight.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub btn9_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnnine.Click
        TextBox1.Text = btnnine.Text
    End Sub

    Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click
        total1 = total1 + Val(TextBox1.Text)

        TextBox1.Clear()
    End Sub

    Private Sub Button2_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button2.Click
        total2 = total2 + Val(TextBox1.Text) + total1
        TextBox1.Clear()

        TextBox1.Text = total2
    End Sub

    Private Sub Button4_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs)

    End Sub

    Private Sub Button3_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button3.Click
        TextBox1.Clear()
        total1 = 0
        total2 = 0
    End Sub
End Class

Read full topic
